Task Description: Create a PHP class that fetches currency conversion rates from an external API and stores them in a repository.

Class Description: The FetchConversionRate class is responsible for retrieving currency conversion rates between a base currency and all other available currencies. It uses Guzzle HTTP client to make requests to an external currency API and stores the results in a conversion rate repository.

Attributes:
- baseCurrencyId: int - The ID of the base currency for which conversion rates will be fetched
- currencyRepository: CurrencyRepository - Repository for accessing currency data
- conversionRateRepository: ConversionRateRepository - Repository for storing conversion rates

Methods:
- __construct(int $baseCurrencyId) -> void - Constructor that initializes the base currency ID
- handle(CurrencyRepository $currencyRepository, ConversionRateRepository $conversionRateRepository) -> void - Main method that executes the conversion rate fetching process:
  - Retrieves all currencies from the repository
  - For each target currency, makes an API request to get the conversion rate
  - Stores or updates the conversion rate in the repository
  - Skips invalid currencies and handles API request failures gracefully
wrong_result:
<?php

class FetchConversionRate
{
    private $baseCurrencyId;
    private $currencyRepository;
    private $conversionRateRepository;

    public function __construct(int $baseCurrencyId)
    {
        $this->baseCurrencyId = $baseCurrencyId;
    }

    public function handle(CurrencyRepository $currencyRepository, ConversionRateRepository $conversionRateRepository)
    {
        $this->currencyRepository = $currencyRepository;
        $this->conversionRateRepository = $conversionRateRepository;

        $currencies = $this->currencyRepository->getAll();
        $baseCurrency = $this->currencyRepository->findById($this->baseCurrencyId);

        if (!$baseCurrency) {
            return;
        }

        $client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();

        foreach ($currencies as $targetCurrency) {
            if ($targetCurrency->getId() === $baseCurrency->getId()) {
                continue;
            }

            try {
                $response = $client->request('GET', 'https://api.exchangerate.host/latest', [
                    'query' => [
                        'base' => $baseCurrency->getCode(),
                        'symbols' => $targetCurrency->getCode()
                    ]
                ]);

                $data = json_decode($response->getBody(), true);

                if (isset($data['rates'][$targetCurrency->getCode()])) {
                    $rate = $data['rates'][$targetCurrency->getCode()];
                    $this->conversionRateRepository->saveOrUpdate(
                        $this->baseCurrencyId,
                        $targetCurrency->getId(),
                        $rate
                    );
                }
            } catch (\Exception $e) {
                continue;
            }
        }
    }
}

Instruction:
Task Description: Create a PHP class that implements an HTTP client using cURL for making HTTP requests with support for various methods (GET, POST, PUT, DELETE, PATCH), custom headers, and request/response logging.

Class Description: The Curl class is an HTTP client implementation that uses PHP's cURL extension to send HTTP requests and handle responses. It supports common HTTP methods, allows configuration of cURL options, handles request headers and parameters, and provides detailed response information including headers, status code, and body.

Attributes:

curlOptions: [array] - Default cURL options including timeout, SSL verification, redirects, etc.
requestArguments: [array] - Stores the current request parameters including URI, method, parameters, and headers.
requestHeader: [array] - Default request headers that can be extended or overridden.
responseBody: [string] - Stores the response body from the last request.
responseHeader: [array] - Stores the response headers from the last request.
responseHttpCode: [int] - Stores the HTTP status code from the last request.
responseClientError: [string|null] - Stores any cURL error from the last request.
responseClientInfo: [array] - Stores cURL info from the last request.
logger: [object|null] - Optional logger instance for request/response logging.

Methods:

request: [request](string $uri, string $method = 'GET', array $parameters = [], array $headers = [], bool $multipart = false) -> string - Makes an HTTP request to the specified URI with given method, parameters and headers. Returns the response body.
getResponse: [getResponse]() -> array - Returns complete request/response information including headers, status code, body, and client info.
setCurlOptions: [setCurlOptions](array $curlOptions) -> void - Sets additional cURL options.
setLogger: [setLogger](object $logger) -> void - Sets a logger instance for request/response logging.
getResponseBody: [getResponseBody]() -> string - Returns the response body from the last request.
getResponseHeader: [getResponseHeader]() -> array - Returns the response headers from the last request.
getResponseHttpCode: [getResponseHttpCode]() -> int - Returns the HTTP status code from the last request.
getResponseClientError: [getResponseClientError]() -> string|null - Returns any cURL error from the last request.
fetchResponseHeader: [fetchResponseHeader](resource $curl, string $header) -> int - Callback function for processing response headers.
prepareRequestHeaders: [prepareRequestHeaders]() -> array - Prepares request headers in cURL format.
getResponseClientInfo: [getResponseClientInfo]() -> array - Returns cURL info from the last request.
getRequestArguments: [getRequestArguments]() -> array - Returns the arguments used for the last request.
wrong_result:
<?php

class Curl {
    private $curlOptions = [
        CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER => true,
        CURLOPT_FOLLOWLOCATION => true,
        CURLOPT_MAXREDIRS => 10,
        CURLOPT_CONNECTTIMEOUT => 30,
        CURLOPT_TIMEOUT => 60,
        CURLOPT_SSL_VERIFYPEER => true,
        CURLOPT_SSL_VERIFYHOST => 2,
        CURLOPT_HEADERFUNCTION => [$this, 'fetchResponseHeader'],
        CURLOPT_USERAGENT => 'PHP Curl Client'
    ];

    private $requestArguments = [];
    private $requestHeader = [];
    private $responseBody = '';
    private $responseHeader = [];
    private $responseHttpCode = 0;
    private $responseClientError = null;
    private $responseClientInfo = [];
    private $logger = null;

    public function request(string $uri, string $method = 'GET', array $parameters = [], array $headers = [], bool $multipart = false): string {
        $this->requestArguments = [
            'uri' => $uri,
            'method' => strtoupper($method),
            'parameters' => $parameters,
            'headers' => $headers,
            'multipart' => $multipart
        ];

        $this->responseHeader = [];
        $this->responseBody = '';
        $this->responseClientError = null;

        $curl = curl_init();
        $this->setRequestOptions($curl, $method, $parameters, $headers, $multipart);
        $this->responseBody = curl_exec($curl);
        $this->responseHttpCode = curl_getinfo($curl, CURLINFO_HTTP_CODE);
        $this->responseClientInfo = curl_getinfo($curl);
        $this->responseClientError = curl_error($curl);

        if ($this->logger) {
            $this->logger->logRequestResponse($this->requestArguments, [
                'headers' => $this->responseHeader,
                'status' => $this->responseHttpCode,
                'body' => $this->responseBody,
                'error' => $this->responseClientError,
                'info' => $this->responseClientInfo
            ]);
        }

        curl_close($curl);
        return $this->responseBody;
    }

    public function getResponse(): array {
        return [
            'request' => $this->requestArguments,
            'response' => [
                'headers' => $this->responseHeader,
                'status' => $this->responseHttpCode,
                'body' => $this->responseBody,
                'error' => $this->responseClientError,
                'info' => $this->responseClientInfo
            ]
        ];
    }

    public function setCurlOptions(array $curlOptions): void {
        $this->curlOptions = $curlOptions + $this->curlOptions;
    }

    public function setLogger(object $logger): void {
        $this->logger = $logger;
    }

    public function getResponseBody(): string {
        return $this->responseBody;
    }

    public function getResponseHeader(): array {
        return $this->responseHeader;
    }

    public function getResponseHttpCode(): int {
        return $this->responseHttpCode;
    }

    public function getResponseClientError(): ?string {
        return $this->responseClientError;
    }

    public function fetchResponseHeader($curl, string $header): int {
        $length = strlen($header);
        $header = trim($header);
        if (!empty($header)) {
            if (strpos($header, 'HTTP/') === 0) {
                $this->responseHeader = [];
            } else {
                list($key, $value) = explode(':', $header, 2);
                $this->responseHeader[trim($key)] = trim($value);
            }
        }
        return $length;
    }

    public function getResponseClientInfo(): array {
        return $this->responseClientInfo;
    }

    public function getRequestArguments(): array {
        return $this->requestArguments;
    }

    private function setRequestOptions($curl, string $method, array $parameters, array $headers, bool $multipart): void {
        $options = $this->curlOptions;
        $options[CURLOPT_URL] = $this->requestArguments['uri'];
        $options[CURLOPT_CUSTOMREQUEST] = $method;

        $requestHeaders = $this->prepareRequestHeaders($headers);
        if (!empty($requestHeaders)) {
            $options[CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER] = $requestHeaders;
        }

        if (!empty($parameters)) {
            if ($method === 'GET') {
                $options[CURLOPT_URL] .= (strpos($options[CURLOPT_URL], '?') === false ? '?' : '&') . http_build_query($parameters);
            } else {
                $options[CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS] = $multipart ? $parameters : http_build_query($parameters);
            }
        }

        curl_setopt_array($curl, $options);
    }

    private function prepareRequestHeaders(array $headers): array {
        $defaultHeaders = [
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/x-www-form-urlencoded'
        ];

        $mergedHeaders = array_merge($defaultHeaders, $headers);
        $formattedHeaders = [];
        foreach ($mergedHeaders as $key => $value) {
            $formattedHeaders[] = "$key: $value";
        }
        return $formattedHeaders;
    }
}

Instruction:
Task Description: Create a PHP class that provides HTTP client functionality using cURL, supporting various HTTP methods, headers, cookies, proxies, and file uploads.

Class Description: The `requests` class is a static HTTP client implementation that handles HTTP requests through cURL. It supports GET, POST, and other HTTP methods, manages cookies, headers, user agents, proxies, and file uploads. The class maintains connection settings and request history.

Attributes:

VERSION: [string] - The version number of the requests class
ch: [resource|null] - The cURL handle resource
timeout: [int|array] - Timeout settings for the connection
encoding: [string|null] - Request encoding
output_encoding: [string|null] - Response encoding
cookies: [array] - Global cookies to be sent with requests
rawheaders: [array] - Request headers
domain_cookies: [array] - Domain-specific cookies
headers: [array] - Response headers
useragents: [array] - List of user agent strings
client_ips: [array] - List of client IP addresses for spoofing
proxies: [array] - List of proxy servers
raw: [string] - Raw response including headers
head: [string] - Response headers
content: [string] - Response body
text: [string] - Processed response text
info: [array] - cURL request information
history: [int] - HTTP redirect history status code
status_code: [int] - HTTP response status code
error: [string] - Error message if request fails

Methods:

init(): [void] -> [resource] - Initializes the cURL session with default settings
request($url, $method = 'GET', $fields = array(), $files = array(), $allow_redirects = true, $cert = NULL) -> [string|bool] - Executes an HTTP request to the specified URL with given parameters
_is_url($url) -> [bool] - Validates if the input string is a valid URL
get_cookies($domain = '') -> [array] - Retrieves cookies for a specific domain
get_response_headers($header) -> [array] - Parses response headers
get_response_cookies($header, $domain) -> [void] - Extracts cookies from response headers
split_header_body() -> [array] - Splits response into headers and body
get_history($header) -> [int] - Gets redirect history from response headers
get_mimetype($filepath) -> [string] - Gets MIME type of a file
wrong_result:
<?php
class requests {
    const VERSION = '1.0.0';
    public static $ch = null;
    public static $timeout = 30;
    public static $encoding = null;
    public static $output_encoding = null;
    public static $cookies = array();
    public static $rawheaders = array();
    public static $domain_cookies = array();
    public static $headers = array();
    public static $useragents = array();
    public static $client_ips = array();
    public static $proxies = array();
    public static $raw = '';
    public static $head = '';
    public static $content = '';
    public static $text = '';
    public static $info = array();
    public static $history = 0;
    public static $status_code = 0;
    public static $error = '';

    public static function init() {
        self::$ch = curl_init();
        curl_setopt(self::$ch, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, true);
        curl_setopt(self::$ch, CURLOPT_HEADER, true);
        curl_setopt(self::$ch, CURLOPT_TIMEOUT, self::$timeout);
        curl_setopt(self::$ch, CURLOPT_CONNECTTIMEOUT, self::$timeout);
        curl_setopt(self::$ch, CURLOPT_SSL_VERIFYPEER, false);
        curl_setopt(self::$ch, CURLOPT_SSL_VERIFYHOST, false);
        curl_setopt(self::$ch, CURLOPT_FOLLOWLOCATION, false);
        return self::$ch;
    }

    public static function request($url, $method = 'GET', $fields = array(), $files = array(), $allow_redirects = true, $cert = null) {
        if (!self::_is_url($url)) {
            self::$error = 'Invalid URL';
            return false;
        }

        if (self::$ch === null) {
            self::init();
        }

        $method = strtoupper($method);
        curl_setopt(self::$ch, CURLOPT_URL, $url);
        curl_setopt(self::$ch, CURLOPT_CUSTOMREQUEST, $method);

        if (!empty(self::$rawheaders)) {
            curl_setopt(self::$ch, CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER, self::$rawheaders);
        }

        if (!empty(self::$cookies)) {
            $cookies = array();
            foreach (self::$cookies as $key => $value) {
                $cookies[] = $key . '=' . $value;
            }
            curl_setopt(self::$ch, CURLOPT_COOKIE, implode('; ', $cookies));
        }

        if (!empty($files)) {
            foreach ($files as $key => $file) {
                if (version_compare(PHP_VERSION, '5.5.0') >= 0) {
                    $fields[$key] = new CURLFile($file);
                } else {
                    $fields[$key] = '@' . $file;
                }
            }
        }

        if (!empty($fields)) {
            curl_setopt(self::$ch, CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS, $fields);
        }

        if ($allow_redirects) {
            curl_setopt(self::$ch, CURLOPT_FOLLOWLOCATION, true);
            curl_setopt(self::$ch, CURLOPT_MAXREDIRS, 10);
        }

        if ($cert !== null) {
            curl_setopt(self::$ch, CURLOPT_CAINFO, $cert);
        }

        self::$raw = curl_exec(self::$ch);
        self::$info = curl_getinfo(self::$ch);
        self::$status_code = self::$info['http_code'];

        if (curl_errno(self::$ch)) {
            self::$error = curl_error(self::$ch);
            return false;
        }

        $response = self::split_header_body();
        self::$head = $response['header'];
        self::$content = $response['body'];
        self::$headers = self::get_response_headers(self::$head);
        self::get_response_cookies(self::$head, parse_url($url, PHP_URL_HOST));
        self::$history = self::get_history(self::$head);

        if (self::$output_encoding !== null) {
            self::$text = mb_convert_encoding(self::$content, self::$output_encoding);
        } else {
            self::$text = self::$content;
        }

        return self::$text;
    }

    private static function _is_url($url) {
        return filter_var($url, FILTER_VALIDATE_URL) !== false;
    }

    public static function get_cookies($domain = '') {
        if ($domain === '') {
            return self::$cookies;
        }
        return isset(self::$domain_cookies[$domain]) ? self::$domain_cookies[$domain] : array();
    }

    public static function get_response_headers($header) {
        $headers = array();
        $header_lines = explode("\r\n", $header);
        foreach ($header_lines as $line) {
            if (strpos($line, ':') !== false) {
                list($key, $value) = explode(':', $line, 2);
                $headers[trim($key)] = trim($value);
            }
        }
        return $headers;
    }

    public static function get_response_cookies($header, $domain) {
        $header_lines = explode("\r\n", $header);
        foreach ($header_lines as $line) {
            if (stripos($line, 'Set-Cookie:') === 0) {
                $cookie = trim(substr($line, 11));
                $parts = explode(';', $cookie);
                $name_value = explode('=', trim($parts[0]), 2);
                if (count($name_value) == 2) {
                    $name = $name_value[0];
                    $value = $name_value[1];
                    self::$cookies[$name] = $value;
                    if (!isset(self::$domain_cookies[$domain])) {
                        self::$domain_cookies[$domain] = array();
                    }
                    self::$domain_cookies[$domain][$name] = $value;
                }
            }
        }
    }

    public static function split_header_body() {
        $header_size = self::$info['header_size'];
        return array(
            'header' => substr(self::$raw, 0, $header_size),
            'body' => substr(self::$raw, $header_size)
        );
    }

    public static function get_history($header) {
        $header_lines = explode("\r\n", $header);
        foreach ($header_lines as $line) {
            if (preg_match('/^HTTP\/\d\.\d (\d{3})/', $line, $matches)) {
                return (int)$matches[1];
            }
        }
        return 0;
    }

    public static function get_mimetype($filepath) {
        if (function_exists('finfo_file')) {
            $finfo = finfo_open(FILEINFO_MIME_TYPE);
            $mimetype = finfo_file($finfo, $filepath);
            finfo_close($finfo);
            return $mimetype;
        } elseif (function_exists('mime_content_type')) {
            return mime_content_type($filepath);
        } else {
            return 'application/octet-stream';
        }
    }
}

Instruction:
Task Description: Create a PHP class that utilizes the Guzzle HTTP client to fetch content from a URL and load it into a DOM object.

Class Description: The `Dom` class provides functionality to load HTML content from a URL using the Guzzle HTTP client. It allows for optional customization of the HTTP client and request objects, and handles the response to extract the content for DOM processing.

Methods:

Method1: `loadFromUrl(string $url, ?Options $options = null, ?ClientInterface $client = null, ?RequestInterface $request = null)` -> `Dom` - Loads HTML content from the specified URL using the provided or default Guzzle HTTP client and request objects. The content is then loaded into a DOM object. Throws various exceptions for error handling.

Input Parameters:
- `$url`: string - The URL from which to fetch the HTML content.
- `$options`: ?Options - Optional configuration options for the DOM loading process.
- `$client`: ?ClientInterface - Optional Guzzle HTTP client instance. If not provided, a default client is created.
- `$request`: ?RequestInterface - Optional Guzzle HTTP request instance. If not provided, a default GET request is created.

Output:
- Returns an instance of `Dom` with the loaded HTML content.
wrong_result:
<?php

use GuzzleHttp\ClientInterface;
use GuzzleHttp\Psr7\Request;
use GuzzleHttp\Psr7\RequestInterface;
use DOMDocument;

class Dom
{
    private $dom;

    public function loadFromUrl(string $url, ?Options $options = null, ?ClientInterface $client = null, ?RequestInterface $request = null): Dom
    {
        $client = $client ?? new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
        $request = $request ?? new Request('GET', $url);

        $response = $client->send($request);
        $html = (string) $response->getBody();

        $this->dom = new DOMDocument();
        @$this->dom->loadHTML($html);

        return $this;
    }
}
